title: Can we get a legit update on Fiora's rework?
body:
Last I heard of it, it was "...still in the works...", but can we get more than that?

Who is in charge of her rework?

When will it be open for discussion from the staff?

How much of it is complete?

How much of it isn't complete?

Does her proposed kit now have any CC? Escape?

What from her current kit will be kept? What will be scrapped?

**Something? Anything?**

replies.body:
Fiora's being actively worked on right now, both in terms of gameplay and art adjustments. She's not one of the next updates out (those'll be GP and MF), but will probably be one of the next updates after them. 

On the gameplay side the guiding pillar's remained 'Grand Duelist', with abilities focused on dueling enemies, with speed and timing emphasized. Single target damage and mobility are likely to remain her strengths. She'll probably end up with a bit of situational CC and a bit more disengage than at present, though in exchange have a somewhat less guaranteed combat pattern (e.g. we've been testing a Q dash that's free targeted, rather than certain to hit once cast). In terms of existing weaknesses we expect she'll continue to lack AOE power and will still be a non tanky melee damage dealer. More details/discussion to follow closer to her release of course.

Please don't give Fiora CC! One of the things I love most about her is how her power budget is all invested in damage. Fiora doesn't need any dirty tricks to take people down, she fights honourably. 

I really hope you guys don't change what people love about her :<
I'm absolutely all for some CC on Fiora even if it's just situational! ;)

How/why would she CC someone though? She is the most expert fencer/duelist in Demacia, I think Fiora would want to fight someone at their best, one on one. I like how, instead of slowing her opponent, Fiora herself moves and attacks faster as she fights. Fiora is arrogant, she's all about her own skill and ability. It's all about her.

Consider how champions CCs fit into their characters.. Darius hamstrings you because he's brutal and he doesn't play by the rules, he just wants to crush you. Ahri charms you because she uses her beauty to steal people's essences. Fiddle is frightening and makes you flee in terror. Fiora... Fiora should just want to defeat you honourably. CC doesn't fit into her archetype imo.

A small stun doesn't seem out of place at all for a fencer type champion. I'd think of it as something similar to knocking them so hard that they stagger for a second, creating an opening, and taking that chance to strike. Seems like something you might get off of a successful riposte, maybe. I don't think she'd get like a real serious business dedicated stun ability, and I wouldn't want to see it be a long duration stun either. That would just be silly for a melee DPS character.

Now that you mention it, I could see a small knock-back/interrupt (think Quinn E) making sense. That would feel pretty nice, like you were overpowering/out-skilling your opponent. I really wouldn't like anything more than that, though.
I could even see something like a disarm on riposte. Like melee attackers are disarmed for 1 second and unable to attack in this duration.
Champion loses all bonus AD/AP for 1sec? Disarmed? lol

I really like this idea!
I also like how this might interact with Veigar ultimate.

Veigar is running away from an enemy Ahri, waiting for his ult to come back up.
Veigar's ultimate comes off cooldown, so he ults Ahri, expecting to kill her.
Fiora shows out of nowhere to save Veigar and disarms Ahri.
Ahri doesn't die because she has 0 AP.
I honestly really like this idea on a champ. Interesting concept.

This ^

Though I suppose if Riot is changing lore around then Fiora might not be the same person we know anymore. I guess she might end up as a duelist that relies on dirty tricks like her old man in her current lore...but I'd be extremely disappointed if this was the case.

Perhaps the "situational CC" could somehow only apply to people trying to interrupt her duel??? Like she marks a target and any other champion that deals damage to her gets slowed or something??

**I'd like to think it's possible for this game to have a duelist that doesn't have to stun you and deal most of their damage to you while you can't fight back - please keep Fiora as a champ like that Riot**

Her kit is far from honorable. What do you normally do when faced with an enemy? Burst of Speed, Riposte, Lunge, Lunge, Ult, win the fight. Absolutely no space for counterplay. Where is the honor in a fight that they have no chance of winning?

Look at her lore. She's trying to restore the family name of her aristocratic house and bring honour back to it after her father destroyed their reputation. 

You can argue that her kit isn't currently honourable (I disagree) but the fact remains that it SHOULD be, and that is what Riot should aim for. Everything about her kit should accentuate the fact that she is an arrogant but honourable duelist. 

She should also be at odds with Jax, her rival. She should work differently to him, he's got that dueling with CC thing on lock imo.

We can sit here all night and go back and fourth, but that's not my style.

What I'm trying to get at is a little bit of CC (a single-target slow/stun) won't wreck her reputation. Her reputation now is what's wrecking her reputation. LOL

Trust me, I love Fiora the way she is, her lore, her style, everything, but her kit now is what's holding her back from shining in the competitive scene and just in general. Your typical top laner isn't meant for straight damage. Many, if not all, top laners have at least something (CC/utility wise) to bring to the table i.e. Irelia's slow/stun, Riven's knock-up and stun, Maokai's root etc.

I don't care about the competitive scene though, I care about my champion that I've played literally hundreds of games on. If they change her, I still want it to be the champion I know and love. 

I'd hate for her to become some OP pro pick that is banned all the time and then nerfed. If they ruin her I'd probably stop playing.

nieche case. there are a handful of champions or so with an ability that can be blocked by riposte. and theyre all on a shorter cooldown.

against a lot of single target poke abilities, the spell is useless. it doesnt help you with the stuff that actually gets you killed. usually single target spells with hard cc attached.

im not even saying to remove riposte. im saying to put more power into it, and have a successful riposte enable other abilities in her kit.

its her core ability. its what makes her unique. it should be more impactful than it is.


for example picture this: 

- riposte is on a 10 second cooldown at all ranks. the uptime of the spell is half a second, giving you very small windows of deflection, so you have to use it in response to an enemy attack, and cant just sit on it for 2 seconds like a shield.
- in return it can block all projectiles, auto attacks and blocks on hit effects that are associated with auto attacks. basically like a private windwall that blocks 1 projectile or auto attack. damage return is removed (put onto her e)
- successfully blocking an attack puts it on 2.5/2/1.5/1/0.5 second cooldown instead of 10
- her q damages everything she passes through, and is put on an ammo system on a very short cooldown (scales with attack speed, ~0.5 seconds by lategame). she charges up to 2 stacks over time (one every 20 seconds). a successful riposte instanly gives her a stack
- her e is changed to a massivley empowered auto attack on first activation and backwards dash on second activation, that enables for like 5 seconds after a successful riposte. the second activation is cancelled by q.
- her ult removes all the restrictions from her abilities for a limited duration. her q doesnt consume charges, her e is available for the entire duration and her riposte has its reduced cooldown.


now imagine this scenario. your opponent pokes at you. you react with riposte. you dash in with q + aa, another q + aa, reset the aa with your e for another big hit immediately followed by a backwards dash out of range. since your riposte was successful, it goes off cooldown incredibly fast, allowing you to react to follow up poke.

or imagine a chase scenario against an ad carry. each auto attack you block would give you another charge for your q, which helps you chase him down as  long as you keep blocking his attacks. which is pretty difficult on a .5 second uptime.

on the flipside, if you miss a riposte or your opponent baits it out, it puts you into a  vulnerable spot for like 10 seconds.

A "duelist" is a more general term than I think is being given by the "anti-fiora-changes" groups in this thread. She's the grand *duelist*, who happens to use a rapier. I believe people mistake it for strict by-the-books fencing. 

She's not a samurai character who would fight an obviously suicidal battle and die "for honor", nor is she restrained to fighting using a specific ruleset as a fencer is. 

Being the "Grand Duelist" simply means she wins all her duels. It doesn't necessarily mean she doesn't play dirty, and in fact would make sense that she does (to some degree) if "playing dirty" is defined as breaking our real-world fencing/kendo rulesets. The belief that Fiora will only fight a fair fight and would never run comes from people drawing associations and conclusions from information that was never given and adding their own real-world representation of a fencing and kendo-style dueling to the character.

Now, this doesn't mean she doesn't have a code of honor or avoids certain un-sportsmanlike things (for example, it was disgraceful that her Father slipped poison in a drink), but that doesn't mean things like pommel bashes, attacks to the legs, or disabling moves in general are illegal in her dueling code-of-honor (while they are in RL fencing/kendo). 

Furthermore, in a fight to the death, there's also no reason to believe, as we have literally zero evidence suggesting it, that Fiora would be *unwilling* to concede defeat and escape from an unwinnable fight. In fact, it would be *out* of character for her to not know when a fight is lost and react accordingly. She's arrogant, not foolhardy, and is the best *duelist*, which means she wins 1 on 1 fights using speed and deflection, and you *have* to be able to read your opponent to parry and win with speed. This would all imply that she'd be able to read a fight, assess her chances of winning, and conclude she can't win that particular trade and try again later. If she dies, she "loses". She doesn't like losing.

A little late on the commenting thing, but you do know the definition of duelist and duel right? I'm pretty sure you didn't have people booking it out of a duel when they thought the were gonna lose.  Duel - A prearranged, formal combat between two persons, usually fought to settle a point of honour. Duelist - A person engaged in a duel. There you have it. It's like a smurf game when someone is like, "Yeah? Well meet me top." and then you go and wreck them without any of their pals getting involved. She doesn't disengage because she's in it to win it. To back off is to lose face, and that's not what a duelist wants. To lose face is to lose honour, and to lose honour is to become no more than a mere brawler. She's not the grand brawler, but the Grand Duelist. If she dies, she dies with honour. It's that simple. She's willing to die in a duel because that's a possible outcome. My point is, she goes into the duel knowing that the loss of life is possible, and that by putting her life on the line and fighting honourably, and by the rules, and coming out on top, she has not only sufficiently defended her and her family's honour, but increased it and the prestige of herself and her family.

I'm perfectly aware of what people have *decided* duels mean in runeterra. 

As I'd made abundantly clear, the ***assumptions*** about what a "Grand Duelist" is are the problem. 

It's pretty obvious that the fights going on in a 5v5 game *are not duels in the traditional sense*, pretending otherwise is just simple denial.

Sure, in a true sanctioned duel I'd buy that Fiora would pointlessly, idiotically, unintelligently fight to her death (cuz apparently people have taken their headcanon and decided Fiora is a fuckin' moron who's as obsessed with the notion of honor that she'd do that, like some female Garen knockoff), but when it's an ACTUAL fight that ACTUALLY matters, there's literally nothing supporting the belief that she'd idiotically and selfishly die in the midst of an important conflict over an important issue with 4 teammates counting on her just because "durr hurr honor".

 She wants to bring notoriety and respect back to her tarnished house, that doesn't mean she's a goddamn imbecile who thinks "yeah, dying for no goddamn reason cuz of my ego is definitely respectable and brings tons of fame to my family name". That's purely 100% people forcibly turning her into a dumber, less interesting character than she is or could be because they're so obsessed with the belief that top lane is a duel (and it's NOT and learning that will make you win a fuckload more games, fyi) that they ignore that the Summoner's Rift scenario isn't something you get to just assume functions the same way as whatever real-world sport you have decided it is.

"It's that simple". There's a serious issue with fans shoving their own ideas about these characters in and then QQing when Riot or *other* fans say something contrary to it. People having the ego to say things like "X wouldn't support Y champion's design because I decided so cuz this is what I think Z means and thus it's now canon" is just plain ignorant.

In terms of existing weaknesses we expect she'll continue to lack AOE power and will still be a non tanky melee damage dealer. More details/discussion to follow closer to her release of course.

Yes!!!!!!!! I'm so excited!

This thread makes me so happy! Especially the comment from Riot. I rarely ever see any comments about Fiora, so thank you Riot.

I just started playing her not too long ago, and have decided to main her. I see many people play her in ranked, and she snowballs very quickly.

The one thing I hope they address is her reliability. All feast or famine champions should be reworked IMO. Fiora, Yasuo, Tryndamere, etc. Either you fall behind and become a burden to your teammates because you're so weak, or you go lane to lane overwhelming them and forcing them to come together just to fight you off. It's not interesting game play, but it can be nice for climbing.

I hope they sacrifice the cheese so she can have a higher skill cap and make more interesting plays. I do like that she requires quick reflexes and timing. However she is the grand duelist, not the destroyer. Mindlessly cutting down the enemy team after you get a little fed is fun at first, but you quickly get bored of champions that do that. Holding your own when you are countered is one of the hardest things to do as Fiora. Ganks are scarce on top already, but sometimes even that isn't enough. 

Situational CC would be amazing on her, or really anything that helps her become a more well rounded champion is welcome. 

I'm also hoping that with this rework we might get a new skin as well? I can dream I guess.
